abstract: The summary of exposures for a specific time period or report type.
overview:
## Overview

The exposure summary item provides a summary of exposures for a particular day. The framework computes this summary by compiling values for a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/weightedDurationSum], a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/maximumScore] (the maximum of the exposure risk values), and a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/scoreSum]. This summary of exposures can be for a specific report type ([doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureDaySummary/confirmedTestSummary]) or a combination across all report types ([doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureDaySummary/daySummary]). An instance of [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureDaySummary] contains the exposure summary item.

To illustrate how the framework computes this value, assume Alice encounters Bob, Carol, and Dave on a particular day; each person has weights set by their respective Public Health Authority.

Bob’s minutes-at-attenuation weight is 50, his infectiousness weight is 100%, and his report type weight is 200% (a confirmed test). His exposure risk value is 100 as dictated by his Public Health Authority.



Carol’s minutes-at-attenuation weight is 30, her infectiousness weight is 100%, and her report type weight is 100% (a confirmed clinical diagnosis). Her exposure risk value is 30 as dictated by her Public Health Authority.



Dave’s minutes-at-attenuation weight is 40, his infectiousness weight is 0%, and his report type weight is 80% (a self-diagnosis). His exposure risk value is 0 as dictated by his Public Health Authority.



Alice’s exposure summary item for that day would be a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/weightedDurationSum] of 120 (50 + 30 + 40), a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/maximumScore] of 100 (the maximum of the exposure risk values), and a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/scoreSum] of 130 (100 + 30).

# ENExposureSummaryItem

**Class**

The summary of exposures for a specific time period or report type.

## Declaration

```swift
class ENExposureSummaryItem
```

## Overview



The exposure summary item provides a summary of exposures for a particular day. The framework computes this summary by compiling values for a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/weightedDurationSum], a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/maximumScore] (the maximum of the exposure risk values), and a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/scoreSum]. This summary of exposures can be for a specific report type ([doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureDaySummary/confirmedTestSummary]) or a combination across all report types ([doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureDaySummary/daySummary]). An instance of [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureDaySummary] contains the exposure summary item.

To illustrate how the framework computes this value, assume Alice encounters Bob, Carol, and Dave on a particular day; each person has weights set by their respective Public Health Authority.

Bob’s minutes-at-attenuation weight is 50, his infectiousness weight is 100%, and his report type weight is 200% (a confirmed test). His exposure risk value is 100 as dictated by his Public Health Authority.



Carol’s minutes-at-attenuation weight is 30, her infectiousness weight is 100%, and her report type weight is 100% (a confirmed clinical diagnosis). Her exposure risk value is 30 as dictated by her Public Health Authority.



Dave’s minutes-at-attenuation weight is 40, his infectiousness weight is 0%, and his report type weight is 80% (a self-diagnosis). His exposure risk value is 0 as dictated by his Public Health Authority.



Alice’s exposure summary item for that day would be a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/weightedDurationSum] of 120 (50 + 30 + 40), a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/maximumScore] of 100 (the maximum of the exposure risk values), and a [doc://com.apple.exposurenotification/documentation/ExposureNotification/ENExposureSummaryItem/scoreSum] of 130 (100 + 30).

## Getting Summary Properties

- **maximumScore**: The highest score of all exposures for this item.
- **scoreSum**: The sum of scores for all exposure for this item.
- **weightedDurationSum**: The sum of exposure durations weighted by their attenuation.

## Summaries

- **ENExposureDetectionSummary**: A summary of exposures.
- **ENExposureDaySummary**: The summary of exposure information for a single day.

## Inherits From

- NSObject

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- NSObjectProtocol
